intro: Descurainia longepedicellata f. magna, commonly known as the giant pedicellate mustard, is a variant of the annual flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, elongated leaves that can reach up to 20 centimeters in length. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and role in its native ecosystems. This form is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, showcasing adaptability to different environmental conditions.
